author: potuz
content: The most common reason for a 1 slot reorg on mainnet is that the proposer was not well connected to the next proposer and the latter didn't see the block in time. In this situation one of the two blocks will necessarily be orphaned

author: m.kalinin
content:
I think this statement is correct if the network is 100% synchronous up to 4s which is unreachable in practice. This is actually the idea behind safe block algorithm. But even on the mainnet participation rate isn't 100% which reflects either asynchrony or other issue with different validators, there are missed slots too which pushes us further from this theoretical statement.

On testnets with much lower participation rates (which I am using now as an indicator of various issues) than on the mainnet situations with reorg is even worse. Mainnet post-Merge should be much more stable in that regard
